channel.title: c6 on dfangx's website
channel.description: Recent content in c6 on dfangx's website

item.title: Day 117, 1 Chronicles 6
item.description: The author recounts the genealogy of Levi. Of the sons of Kohath came Aaron, Moses, and Ahitub. The line of Kohath was recorded until the exile by Babylon.

item.title: Day 112, Psalm 6, 8-10, 14, 16, 19, 21
item.description: Psalm 6 is a cry for help to God during suffering and a statement of hope in the steadfast love of God.

item.title: Day 99, 1 Samuel 4-8
item.description: Israel went to war against the Philistines and were defeated in battle. In response, Israel brought the the ark of the covenant into their camp.

item.title: Day 91, Judges 6-7
item.description: Again, Israel did what was evil before God, so God let Midian rule over them. The oppression of Israel was very harsh, and Israel cried out to God.

item.title: Day 83, Joshua 5-8
item.description: The people west of the Jordan heard of Israel’s Jordan crossing by God’s hand, and they all lost heart. Remarkably, this was the time when God told Joshua to circumcise the new generation of Israel, since they would be putting themselves in a very vulnerable state in the middle of enemy territory.

item.title: Day 72, Deuteronomy 5-7
item.description: Moses presents the covenant God made with the people of Israel at Horeb (Sinai). He emphasizes the setting which the covenant was made in and the people’s reaction to it.

item.title: Day 56, Numbers 5-6
item.description: A person who is unclean is to be put outside the camp because God, who is holy, dwells within the camp.

item.title: Day 45, Leviticus 5-7
item.description: God also takes into account one’s ability to give the sin offering when he gives the laws. Among the offences that require a sin offering include uncleanness, failure to testify, or any sort of rash oath.

item.title: Day 31, Exodus 4-6
item.description: Moses continues to voice his fears and complaints. God addresses his first by giving him three signs to perform so that Israel may believe.

item.title: Galatians 6
item.description: Brothers need to restore each other in gentleness should any of them sin. Furthermore, while they share each other’s burdens, they must keep in mind that they are held accountable to their own work.

item.title: Day 5, Job 6-9
item.description: Job responds to Eliphaz’s answer. He maintains that his complaints are just and acknowledges once again the sovereignty of God. He maintains that he is still in obedience to God, as he finds the misfortunes that have come upon him to be in God’s will.

item.title: Day 2, Genesis 4-7
item.description: Adam and Eve had two sons, Cain and Abel. Both of them brought an offering to God, but God was only pleased with Abel’s offering of his flock’s firstborn and fat portions.
